Generation II.Gold: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
Generation II.Silver: When numerous meteors illuminate the night sky, sightings of Cleffa strangely increase.
Generation II.Crystal: If the impact site of a meteorite is found, this Pok é mon is certain to be within the immediate area.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) When numerous meteors illuminate the night sky, sightings of Cleffa strangely increase. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these Pok é mon quench their thirst with the morning dew.
Generation III.Sapphire: On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these Pok é mon quench their thirst with the morning dew.
Generation III.Emerald: On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance until daybreak, when they quench their thirst with the morning dew.
Generation III.FireRed: When numerous meteors illuminate the night sky, sightings of Cleffa strangely increase.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

Generation IV.Diamond: Its silhouette is like a star. It is believed to arrive riding on shooting stars.
Generation IV.Pearl: Many appear when the night skies are filled with shooting stars. They disappear with sunrise.
Generation IV.Platinum: It is often seen when shooting stars fill the night skies. It's said to arrive riding on a shooting star.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: When numerous meteors illuminate the night sky, sightings of Cleffa strangely increase.

Generation VI.X: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these Pokémon quench their thirst with the morning dew.

Generation VII.Sun: On late nights illuminated by shooting stars, it gazes intently skyward, as if thinking of its home.
Generation VII.Moon: Because of its silhouette, it's believed to be a star reborn. For some reason, it loves Minior.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: On nights with many shooting stars, they gather in packs and dance in circles. If you should see them, something good will happen!
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Said to have ridden here on a shooting star, Cleffa seem to appear in places where meteorites have struck in the past.

Generation VIII.Sword: According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen in places where shooting stars have fallen.
Generation VIII.Shield: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its silhouette is like a star. It is believed to arrive riding on shooting stars.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Many appear when the night skies are filled with shooting stars. They disappear with sunrise.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: In silhouette, they resemble twinkling starlight. When shooting stars rain from the night sky, Cleffa gather in numbers and dance as though they are indeed incarnations of the stars.

Generation IX.Scarlet: On late nights illuminated by shooting stars, it gazes intently skyward, as if thinking of its home.
Generation IX.Violet: Since it is often seen when shooting stars fill the night skies, it's said to come here by riding on a star.
